title: PM Modi recalls profound sacrifices of Jesus Christ on Good Friday
text:
[+](javascipt:void(0);)
Prime Minister Narendra Modi reflected on the significance of Good Friday, highlighting its message of compassion and forgiveness. He took to social media, stating, “Today, on Good Friday, we remember the profound sacrifice of Jesus Christ. May everyone find strength in the lessons of compassion and forgiveness it teaches us.”
Union Minister Kiren Rijiju also extended Good Friday wishes, emphasizing the values of sacrifice, love, compassion, forgiveness, and unity. He expressed, “On the auspicious occasion of Good Friday, let’s remember the supreme sacrifice and love that guide us towards compassion, love, forgiveness, and unity. May this Good Friday be a time of reflection, renewal, and grace for all.”
West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee joined in wishing the Christian community, saying, “Wishing all my Christian Brothers & Sisters a graceful & blessed Good Friday. May this Holy Day of Penance, Prayers, and Sacrifice inspire us all to live a life of compassion, love, and peace.”
Congress National President Mallikarjun Kharge urged people to embrace the spirit of humanity, kindness, and peace on Good Friday. He expressed, “Wishing you all a blessed #GoodFriday. May the spirit of compassion, forgiveness, sacrifice, and empathy keep guiding our path. Let us imbibe the spirit of humanity, kindness, and peace amongst us.”
Good Friday was commemorated with prayers and processions across the country, depicting the stations of the cross. In Thiruvananthapuram, devotees participated in a procession to Saint Joseph’s Cathedral in Palayam, attended by Member of Parliament for Thiruvananthapuram, Shashi Tharoor. Devotees also offered prayers in the national capital on this solemn occasion.
Good Friday, a Christian holiday, marks the crucifixion and death of Jesus Christ at Calvary. It is the start of the Easter weekend.
